planets.info: Jupiter has at least 69 moons, the four largest is the Galilean moons discovered by Galileo Galilei in 1610.
It is the fourth-largest moon, has the highest density of all the moons, and has the least amount of water of any known astronomical object in the Solar System.
Europa is the smallest of the four Galilean moons orbiting Jupiter, and the sixth-closest to the planet. It is also the sixth-largest moon in the Solar System.
Ganymede is the largest and most massive moon of Jupiter and in the Solar System. The ninth largest object in the Solar System, it is the largest without a substantial atmosphere.
Callisto is the second-largest moon of Jupiter, after Ganymede. At 4821 km in diameter, Callisto has about 99% the diameter of the planet Mercury but only about a third of its mass.
